body.name: 10 inch Android 13 Tablet, 2 in 1 Tablet with Keyboard, Stylus, 8GB+128GB 1TB Expand, 1280x800 IPS, 2.0GHz Quad-Core, WiFi 6, BT5.0, 6000mAh, 2MP+5MP Dual Camera (Gray)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 4 hrs 28 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 12. Order within 2 hrs 43 mins
features: The Ideal Portable Workspace - Transform your tablet into a compact and highly-functional workspace. With the portable 2 in 1 case and keyboard, you can instantly switch between tablet and laptop modes. Making it easy to cope with your daily tasks, the productive world of work and study is at your fingertips.

Faster Responsive Performance - At the heart of our 10 inch tablet is powerful Android 13.0 with Bluetooth 5.0, 2.4G/5G WIFI6, 8(4+4) RAM, 128GB ROM memory and a 2.0GHz quad-core processor. Expand the storage capacity up to 1TB with an additional microSD card slot to store all the content you need.

Large HD Touch Screen - This 10 inch tablet features an FHD IPS display with a wider viewing area and more vibrant colors for a better visual experience.1280x800 pixels ensure that movies are more absorbing and vivid, notes are clearer, and work is more satisfying.

Long-lasting Battery Life - The Android 13 tablet's 6000mAh Li-Ion battery lasts more than 6 hours and can be quickly charged via the Type-C port, making it perfect for home or outdoor travel. The 2MP+5MP HD dual camera is capable of making video calls and taking HD photos.

100% Service Guarantee - Package content: k12 tablet, 2-in-1 keyboard case, power adapter, stylus, screen protector. Our tablets are backed by a 90-day extended return and 1-year warranty, as well as a 7x24 customer service support team. If you encounter any during use, please contact us!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: No solo llegó con bastantes dias de anticipación, sino que cumplió las expectativas con creces... Muchas gracias

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Do not recommend
reviews.reviewText: It can barely support 1 basic app at a time and the screen sensitivity is terrible. It could be an ok large calculator but anything beyond that, it's too slow to meet everyday needs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great size for someone with visual difficulties.
reviews.reviewText: I mostly used the tablet for reading Kindle books. Unfortunately my grandson crawled across my bed and cracked the screen shortly after I bought it, then my son dropped it between the seats in his friend's truck and further damaged it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good sized tablet for a good price
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a gift for a relative a month ago. They used it and liked it so I bought two more for two friends. Good tablet, Android interface. Works well. Relative has been using for about 6-weeks, two friends for about 2-weeks now. No issues. Good price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent little gadget
reviews.reviewText: I like this product very much except for the fact that the mouse is defective and will not connect via Bluetooth even though the keyboard did. I have tried to reach someone to replace it but have had no luck yet. I would be very happy if someone would send a new mouse.Update: I contacted Amazon customer service and because I did not want to return the entire package, they gave me a credit and suggested a different mouse to purchase, an Amazon product, and I did.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The product is Great 👍
reviews.reviewText: The quality is okay, but sometimes it seems a little slow when starting up. All in all it's working perfectwhich is important.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Fine for Light Usage
reviews.reviewText: $100 sure can get you further than it used to when it comes to technology. My Nexus 7 was stolen several years back, which was a basic tablet I used mostly for checking email, browsing light websites, and playing basic games. The K12 tablet pictured here seems to be a decent replacement for it in most ways.First, the screen. While its resolution of 1280x800 isn't Full HD, it is at least IPS which means it does sport pretty good viewing angles. Colors appear fairly accurate, and the backlight gets plenty bright indoors. The screen's topmost layer is plastic, which does not feel good to scroll or swipe with, but it's par for the course at this price point. It'll do to watch an occasional video on, but it's not the most impressive screen I've ever seen, having gotten used to OLEDs at this point. Still, for a budget tablet, it's not too bad.Surprisingly, the K12 tablet supports WiFi 6 networks, as well as Bluetooth (not sure which version). I ran a speed test, and from across our house I managed to pull data at around 100 mbps on a negotiated speed on 200+, so it does appear to support one of the newer networking technologies.The CPU identifier app I used says the SoC is a Rockchip RK3066, which clocks at up to 2.02 GHz. It's a quad core, but on an ancient 40nm process size, paired with a Mali-G52 GPU. All of this is computer nerd speak to say that it's a bottom-of-the-barrel processor. Don't expect to play any high-end games on this thing. I use it for chess, reading Manga, checking email, and not a whole lot else because it isn't really made for much more.There are two cameras, one on the front and one on the back. The back camera includes a flash, but it's so dim it's almost ineffective. These are the kinds of cameras you use in an emergency, when your other devices have died and you need to snap some sort of memory of something happening.I do have to bring to your attention a bit of a misleading stat on this product page. It claims the K12 tablet had 8 GB of RAM. What it actually has is 4 GB of actual RAM, plus what appears to be a user-adjustable amount of RAM-disk or something like it. This is basically a portion of the 128GB of flash storage (a number exactly the same as what the listing says) that is used by the OS like a slower form of RAM. Desktop OSes have something similar called a swap file. The problem is that the SSD on this tablet is much slower than regular RAM, so if you reach the point where the system is using some of this RAM disk, it might be better if you simply closed some apps. This feels like a marketing gimmick - technically, sure, we can say the K12 has 8 GB of RAM. But realistically, only half of it is truly usable (and indeed, the CPU identifier app I used only showed 4 GB of RAM available).There is a microSD card slot to expand storage. I'm thinking of turning it into my offline music player, because it still sports a 3.5mm headphone jack. The K12 is a WiFi-only tablet, as there is no SIM slot nor cellular modem. Not a surprise at this price point.Ultimately, should you buy the K12? Perhaps for a white elephant gift this coming holiday season, or for a kid, or as an ebook reader or music player. I wouldn't recommend it as your main internet-connected device, but rather a standby for when you don't want to do anything too intense and maybe don't want to drain the battery of your regular phone or tablet. Which is basically what I used my last budget tablet for, so in that sense the K12 is an okay purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't hold a charge long long
reviews.reviewText: Was nice for a child but didn't stay charged long enough and screen cracked from the inside and wasn't dropped or anything. Not sure what happened.
